title: Lenses - identify lens type and focal length

content.question: A student places a lens <math alttext="40 centimeters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>40</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cm</mi></math> from an object and observes an enlarged image on a screen on the opposite side of the lens. Which of the following could be the type of lens and the focal length of the lens?

choices.label: A diverging lens with a focal length of <math alttext="30 centimeters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cm</mi></math>
A diverging lens with a focal length of <math alttext="50 centimeters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>50</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cm</mi></math>
A converging lens with a focal length of <math alttext="30 centimeters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cm</mi></math>
A converging lens with a focal length of <math alttext="50 centimeters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>50</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cm</mi></math>

content.answer: A converging lens with a focal length of <math alttext="30 centimeters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cm</mi></math>
